Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "I am...a detective. .........I acknowledge you as my opponent. However, ...are you qualified to participate in this game? You {i:have} managed to fix the logic error, I assume...?"

Russian (RU): "Я... детектив. .........Я признаю вас своим противником. Но... есть ли у вас право участвовать в этой игре? Вам {i:удалось} исправить логическую ошибку?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou...uma detetive. .........Eu a reconheço como minha oponente. Porém, ...você está qualificada para participar deste jogo? Assumo que você {i:foi} capaz de consertar o erro de lógica, certo...?"

PC Japanese (JP): そして見えてくる厨房への扉や食堂の扉…。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, as portas da cozinha e da sala de jantar surgiram em sua visão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後出現在眼前的廚房門和餐廳的門…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后出现在眼前的厨房门和餐厅的门…。

Umineko Project (UP): All of it brings back fond memories.
Steam (ST): All of it brings back fond memories.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All of it brings back fond memories.
PC Japanese (JP): 全てが、全てが懐かしい。
Russian (RU): Всё это навевало приятные воспоминания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Tudo isso trazia agradáveis recordações.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 全部，全部都那麼親切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 全部，全部都那么亲切。

Umineko Project (UP): ......There was the honor and discipline of serving Kinzo directly.
Steam (ST): ...There was the honor and rigidity of serving Kinzo directly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......There was the honor and rigidity of serving Kinzo directly.
PC Japanese (JP): ……金蔵に直接仕えることを許された名誉と、厳しさ。
Russian (RU): ......Служить непосредственно Кинзо было и почётно, и тяжело.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Havia a honra e disciplina de servir Kinzo pessoalmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……直接侍奉金藏，同時給嘉音帶來了榮譽和嚴苛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……直接侍奉金藏，同时给嘉音带来了荣誉和严苛。

Umineko Project (UP): However, that man wasn't strict all the time.
Steam (ST): However, that man wasn't rigid all the time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, that man wasn't rigid all the time.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし彼は、その全ての時間が厳しかったわけではない。
Russian (RU): Но этот человек не всегда был суровым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, aquele homem não era severo o tempo todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，金藏並不是什麼時候都是那麼嚴苛的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，金藏并不是什么时候都是那么严苛的。

Umineko Project (UP): ......When the family was out of sight and he didn't have to preserve that air of majesty, his face could turn unbelievably childish, and he would sometimes ask me to take part in strange pranks.
Steam (ST): ...When the family was out of sight and he didn't have to preserve that air of majesty, his face could turn unbelievably childish, and he would sometimes ask me to take part in strange pranks.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……その威厳を保って見せねばならない家族の姿がない時、信じられないくらい子供っぽい顔を見せて、おかしな悪戯の片棒を頼んできたりするのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Когда рядом не было семьи и он не производил величественное впечатление, его лицо могло стать невероятно детским, а иногда он просил меня поучаствовать в странных шутках.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quando a família não estava, e ele não precisava preservar seu ar de majestade, sua expressão tornava‐se inacreditavelmente infantil e, às vezes, ele me pedia para ajudar em alguma pegadinha estranha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……他必須在家人面前保持威嚴，而當家人不在跟前的時候，他會顯露出令人難以置信的孩子氣的一面，讓別人陪他玩一些奇奇怪怪的惡作劇。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……他必须在家人面前保持威严，而当家人不在跟前的时候，他会显露出令人难以置信的孩子气的一面，让别人陪他玩一些奇奇怪怪的恶作剧。

Umineko Project (UP): .........The Master let me shoot lots of guns, didn't he...
Steam (ST): ......The Master let me shoot lots of guns, didn't he...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………お館様に、銃を色々撃たせてもらったっけ。
Russian (RU): .........Господин дал мне выстрелить из многих ружей...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........O Mestre me deixava atirar com várias armas, não é...?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………老爺，讓我玩過不少槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………老爷，让我玩过不少枪。

Umineko Project (UP): ...That......was pretty fun.
Steam (ST): ...That...was pretty fun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …あれ、……結構、面白かったな。
Russian (RU): ...Было...... очень интересно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Aquilo......era muito divertido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …那個，……很有趣吶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …那个，……很有趣呐。

Umineko Project (UP): Krauss‐sama was actually surprisingly kind.
Steam (ST): Krauss-sama was actually surprisingly kind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Krauss-sama was actually surprisingly kind.
PC Japanese (JP): 旦那様は、案外やさしい人だった。
Russian (RU): Господин Краусс на самом деле был на удивление добрым.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O patrão era, na verdade, surpreendentemente gentil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 主人意外地是個好心腸的人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 主人意外地是个好心肠的人。

Umineko Project (UP): He must have gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
Steam (ST): He must've gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He must have gotten the impression that the Master bullied me a lot.
PC Japanese (JP): 僕が普段、よっぽどお館様にいじめられてると思い込んでいたんだろう。
Russian (RU): Стало быть, у него сложилось впечатление, что Господин слишком сильно меня запугал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele deve ter ficado com a impressão de que o Mestre me maltratava muito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他似乎一直堅定不移地認為，我平時總是被老爺欺負呢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他似乎一直坚定不移地认为，我平时总是被老爷欺负呢。

Umineko Project (UP): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as if he was a classmate of mine.
Steam (ST): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as though he was a classmate of mine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Whenever I was the only one around, he would talk to me in a very familiar way, almost as if he was a classmate of mine.
PC Japanese (JP): 僕しか姿がない時には、まるでクラスメートに話し掛けるように、親しげに話しかけてくれたっけ。
Russian (RU): Наедине он разговаривал со мной так обыденно, будто был моим одноклассником.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sempre que não havia mais ninguém por perto, ele conversava comigo de maneira bem familiar, quase como se fosse um colega de classe.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有我在跟前的時候，他就像跟同學講話似的，非常親切地跟我說話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有我在跟前的时候，他就像跟同学讲话似的，非常亲切地跟我说话。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I sort of regret that I held back and never did anything but nod in return...
Steam (ST): ...I sort of regret that I held back and never did anything but nod in return...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……僕が遠慮して、相槌しか打たなかったことが、少しだけ心残りだ…。
Russian (RU): ......Мне даже жаль, что я сдерживался и всегда ограничивал ответы одним кивком...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu meio que me arrependo de ficar me contento e não responder nada além de assentir com a cabeça...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……有點可惜，我總是有點顧慮而只是隨口附和…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……有点可惜，我总是有点顾虑而只是随口附和…。

Umineko Project (UP): Madam was a really strict person...
Steam (ST): Madam was a really strict person...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Madam was a really strict person...
PC Japanese (JP): 奥様はとにかく厳しい人だったな…。
Russian (RU): Мадам была очень строгой...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A madame era uma pessoa muito severa...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 太太總的來說是個嚴厲的人吶…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 太太总的来说是个严厉的人呐…。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Ever since a rumor spread about her being strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
Steam (ST): ...Ever since some rumor went around saying that she was strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Ever since some rumor went around saying that she was strict on female servants but soft towards male servants, I get the feeling she viewed me as an enemy.
PC Japanese (JP): ……女の使用人には特に厳しかったけど、男の使用人には甘いとの陰口を聞いてしまってからは、僕を目の敵にしていた気がする。
Russian (RU): ......У меня возникло такое чувство, будто она рассматривает меня как врага, ещё с тех пор как пошли слухи, что она строга со служанками, но мягка со слугами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sempre que se espalhava um rumor sobre como ela era rígida com as serviçais, mas dócil com os serviçais, eu tinha o sentimento de que ela se opunha à mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……自從知道我們私下議論說太太對女傭人格外嚴厲，但是對男傭人就比較寬鬆之後，似乎就把我當成了眼中釘。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……自从知道我们私下议论说太太对女佣人格外严厉，但是对男佣人就比较宽松之后，似乎就把我当成了眼中钉。

Umineko Project (UP): However, she was also a woman to be pitied.
Steam (ST): However, she was also a woman to be pitied.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, she was also a woman to be pitied.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、奥様も可哀想な人だった。
Russian (RU): Но также мне было жаль мадам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, ela também era uma mulher digna de pena.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，太太也很可怜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): ......On many occasions when she was alone, I saw her shoulders sagging from her burdens.
Steam (ST): ...When I've seen her alone, I've noticed her shoulders sag with the pain many times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......When I've seen her alone, I've noticed her shoulders sag with the pain many times.
PC Japanese (JP): ……彼女がひとりの時、その肩を辛そうに下げているのを、僕は何度も見ているのだから。
Russian (RU): ......Видя её одну, я много раз замечал, как её плечи прогибались от страданий.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nas muitas ocasiões em que ela estava sozinha, eu via seus ombros exaustos do peso que ela carregava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我好幾次都看到，她獨自一人的時候很難受似的垂頭喪氣的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我好几次都看到，她独自一人的时候很难受似的垂头丧气的样子。

Umineko Project (UP): There were a lot of servants, weren't there...{n}......Some lasted a short while, others longer.
Steam (ST): There were a lot of servants, weren't there... ...Some lasted a short while, others stayed a long time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There were a lot of servants, weren't there.........Some lasted a short while, others stayed a long time.
PC Japanese (JP): 大勢の使用人がいたっけ。……短い間だったり、長い間だったり。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 大勢の使用人がいたっけ。{n}……短い間だったり、長い間だったり。
Russian (RU): Ещё было много слуг...{n}......Некоторые быстро уходили, другие оставались на долгое время.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia muitos serviçais, não havia...?{n}......Uns ficavam pouco tempo, outros muito tempo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 傭人的人數很多。{n}……有相處時間短的，也有相處很久的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 佣人的人数很多。{n}……有相处时间短的，也有相处很久的。

Umineko Project (UP): Genji‐sama is the one person fit to be called my father.
Steam (ST): Genji-sama was the one person I might have called my father.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Genji-sama is the one person fit to call my father.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 源次先生是我唯一能稱作父親的人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 源次先生是我唯一能称作父亲的人。

Steam (ST): ...I am both grateful and resentful towards him over many things.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……感謝も恨みもいっぱいある。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Tenho muitos agradecimentos e ressentimentos por ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對他的感激和憎恨都很多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对他的感激和憎恨都很多。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Over time, all those feelings mixed together, cancelled out, and left me with a neutral emotion.
Steam (ST): ...They all mix together, cancel out, and I end up with a neutral emotion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......They all mix together, cancel out, and I end up with a neutral emotion.
PC Japanese (JP): ……もう全部混ぜこぜで、それらは相殺されてゼロの感情になった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ao mesmo tempo, todos esses sentimentos se misturaram, cancelando‐se e deixando‐me com uma emoção neutra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……如果全部混在一起，互相抵消的話，那就歸零了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……如果全部混在一起，互相抵消的话，那就归零了。

Umineko Project (UP): In that case, Kumasawa‐san could probably be called my mother.
Steam (ST): In that case, Kumasawa-san could probably be called my mother.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that case, Kumasawa-san could probably be called my mother.

Russian (RU): В таком случае, Кумасаву можно назвать моей матерью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nesse caso, a Kumasawa‐san provavelmente era quem eu poderia chamar de mãe.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 这样的话熊泽婆婆就是能称作母亲的人了。

Steam (ST): ...She's helped me out many times.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......She's helped me out many times.
PC Japanese (JP): ……あの人には色々なことを助けてもらった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela me ajudou muitas vezes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……那個人幫過我很多。

Steam (ST): I've always wanted to repay her someday, ...and now I've lost that chance for all time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I've always wanted to repay her someday, ......and now I've lost that chance for all time.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然很想报答她，……但是我已经永远失去这个机会了。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon.........is my big sister.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon.........is my big sister.

Russian (RU): Шаннон......... моя старшая сестра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon.........é minha irmã mais velha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音是，………我的姐姐。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音是，………我的姐姐。

Steam (ST): Without her, I wouldn't have been able to be me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Without her, I wouldn't have been able to be me.

Umineko Project (UP): Thanks for teaching me that the ocean is blue......
Steam (ST): Thanks for teaching me that the ocean is blue...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thanks for teaching me that the ocean is blue......

Russian (RU): Спасибо, что показала мне синий цвет океана......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agradeço a ela por ter me ensinado que o oceano é azul......

Chinese Simplified (CN): 谢谢你，告诉了我大海是蓝色的……。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Gohda? .........I hate that guy.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Gohda? .........Eu odeio aquele cara.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……鄉田？………我討厭那傢伙。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……乡田？………我讨厌那家伙。

Umineko Project (UP): Still, when I complimented his servant stew, he would sometimes turn red and tell me there was enough for seconds. ......I didn't dislike that part of him.
Steam (ST): Still, when I complimented his stew, he would sometimes turn red and say there was enough for seconds. ...I didn't dislike that part of him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Still, when I complimented his stew, he would sometimes turn red and tell me there was enough for seconds. ......I didn't dislike that part of him.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、まかないのシチューを褒めたら、顔を赤くしながらおかわりもあるなんて言い出した単純なところは、……嫌いじゃなかったかもしれない。
Russian (RU): И всё же, когда я хвалил его готовку, он иногда краснел и говорил мне 'Ну хватит, хватит'. ......Такая его сторона мне нравилась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo assim, quando eu elogiava o ensopado que ele preparava para nós, às vezes, ele ficava vermelho e dizia que tinha bastante para repetir. ......Eu não odiava essa parte dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，要是有誰誇他燉菜料理做得好的話，他就會紅著臉說還可以再添的，這種單純的地方，……搞不好我也不算很討厭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，要是有谁夸他炖菜料理做得好的话，他就会红着脸说还可以再添的，这种单纯的地方，……搞不好我也不算很讨厌。

Umineko Project (UP): I wonder why such strong memories popped up in the short time it took me to ran past the dining hall...
Steam (ST): I wonder why such a strong memory popped up at the instant I ran past the dining hall...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wonder why such a strong memory popped up during the instant I ran past the dining hall...
PC Japanese (JP): 食堂の前を駆け抜けるだけのわずかの時間に、どうしてこれほどに濃密な記憶が。
Russian (RU): Интересно, почему, когда я пробежал мимо столовой, всплыли такие сильные воспоминания...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pergunto‐me por que memórias tão fortes surgiram na minha cabeça durante o curto momento que levou para eu atravessar a sala de jantar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是從餐廳前面穿過，這短短的時間，為什麼會喚起這麼多鮮明的回憶呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是从餐厅前面穿过，这短短的时间，为什么会唤起这么多鲜明的回忆呢？

Steam (ST): And then, ...my memories of Jessica.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And then, ......my memories of Jessica.

Steam (ST): ...Ooh. ...I-It's a boy servant... ...How...old are you...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Ooh. ......I, it's a boy servant... ......How......old are you...?
PC Japanese (JP): ……へぇ。……お、男の子の使用人なんだ…。……君、……いくつ…？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……へぇ。……お、男の子の使用人なんだ…。{n}……君、……いくつ…？

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……嘿。……是、是个男孩子的佣人啊…。{n}……你，……多大了…？

Umineko Project (UP): I think those were the first words she spoke to me.
Steam (ST): I think those were the first words she spoke to me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): ......Come to think about it, she was probably interested in me ever since then.
Steam (ST): ...Come to think about it, she was probably interested in me ever since then.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……思えば、その時から彼女は僕に興味を持ってくれていたんだと思う。
Russian (RU): ......Возможно, она заинтересовалась мной уже тогда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Pensando nisso agora, ela deve ter ficado interessada em mim desde então.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……回想起來，大概從那時起她就對我感興趣了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……回想起来，大概从那时起她就对我感兴趣了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): We really did......have enough time to build up a love that could have competed with the love between George‐sama and Shannon.
Steam (ST): I really did...have enough time to build up a love that wouldn't lose to George-sama and Shannon's.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I really did......have enough time to build up a love that wouldn't lose to George-sama and Shannon's.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女とは、……譲治さまと紗音の二人に負けないくらいの愛を築く時間が、本当はあったんだ。
Russian (RU): У меня...... было достаточно времени, чтобы построить любовь, которая не проиграла бы любви Шаннон и господина Джорджа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nós realmente......tivemos tempo o bastante para construir um amor que pudesse competir com o amor entre o George‐sama e Shannon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我和她，……確實有過那樣一些時候，能夠讓我們構築起不輸讓治少爺和紗音的愛情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我和她，……确实有过那样一些时候，能够让我们构筑起不输让治少爷和纱音的爱情。

Umineko Project (UP): But since I could only see the gray sea, I wasted almost all of that time.
Steam (ST): But...since I could only see the gray sea, I wasted almost all of that time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But...since I could only see the gray sea, I wasted almost all of that time.
PC Japanese (JP): なのに、灰色の海しか僕が見えなかったから、その時間のほとんど全てを失った。
Russian (RU): Но... я видел только серое море и всё время потратил зря.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas como eu só podia ver o mar acinzentado, eu desperdicei praticamente todo o tempo que tive.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，我卻只能看到灰色的大海，而幾乎浪費了那所有的時間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，我却只能看到灰色的大海，而几乎浪费了那所有的时间。

Umineko Project (UP): What does she like about me?{n}What do I like about her?
Steam (ST): What does she like about me? What do I like about her?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): What does she like about me? What do I like about her?
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女は僕の何が好きなのか。僕は彼女の何が好きなのか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 彼女は僕の何が好きなのか。{n}僕は彼女の何が好きなのか。
Russian (RU): Что ей во мне нравится?{n}Что мне в ней нравится?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que ela gostava em mim?{n}O que eu gostava nela?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她喜歡我的什麼地方？{n}我喜歡她的什麼地方？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她喜欢我的什么地方？{n}我喜欢她的什么地方？

Umineko Project (UP): I get the feeling we were never really able to clarify that for ourselves.
Steam (ST): I get the feeling we never really made that clear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I get the feeling we never really made that clear.
PC Japanese (JP): それさえも、はっきりさせることが出来なかった気がする。
Russian (RU): Кажется, мы так и не выяснили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sinto que nós nunca fomos capazes de definir claramente isso por nós mesmos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 似乎連這些都還沒搞清楚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 似乎连这些都还没搞清楚。

Umineko Project (UP): ......No, she told me.
Steam (ST): ...No, she told me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……いいや、彼女は言っていた。
Russian (RU): ......Хотя нет, она говорила мне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não, ela me disse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不，她說過的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不，她说过的。

Umineko Project (UP): There's nothing wrong with spending more time together to eventually find that out.
Steam (ST): We should've stayed together longer to eventually find that out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We should have stayed together longer to eventually find that out.
PC Japanese (JP): それを知るために、もっと近付きあうのもいいんじゃないかって。
Russian (RU): Мы должны были быть вместе дольше, чтобы в конце концов выяснить.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não há nada de errado em passar mais tempo juntos para eventualmente descobrirmos isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就是為了搞清楚這些，才互相接近，不也很好嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就是为了搞清楚这些，才互相接近，不也很好吗？

Umineko Project (UP): ......The reasons for love could have come later on.
Steam (ST): ...It would've been fine to find reasons for our love later.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......The reasons for love could be dealt with later.
PC Japanese (JP): ……恋の理由なんて、後でも良かったんだ。
Russian (RU): ......Причины любить можно было отложить на потом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......As razões do amor poderiam vir mais tarde.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……戀愛的理由，以後再說也無所謂。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……恋爱的理由，以后再说也无所谓。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It took me...far too long...to realize that.
Steam (ST): ...It took me... far too long... to realize that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It took me... far too long... to realize that.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それに気付くのが、僕は余りに、遅い。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……それに気付くのが、僕は余りに、遅い。
Russian (RU): ......Я слишком... поздно... понял.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Demorou muito tempo...para mim...perceber isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這一點，我實在，發現得太晚了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这一点，我实在，发现得太晚了。

Umineko Project (UP): .........Now, I think I can accept it.
Steam (ST): ......Now, I think I can accept it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ………今なら、少し納得できるよ。
Russian (RU): .........Теперь я могу смириться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Agora, acho que posso aceitar isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………現在的話，我有點明白了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………现在的话，我有点明白了。

Umineko Project (UP): I know why Shannon won the duel.
Steam (ST): I know why Shannon won the duel.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I know why Shannon won the duel.
PC Japanese (JP): どうして紗音が決闘に勝ったか。
Russian (RU): Я знаю, почему Шаннон победила в дуэли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sei porque Shannon venceu o duelo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為什麼紗音贏了決鬥？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为什么纱音赢了决斗？

Umineko Project (UP): God must have been watching.
Steam (ST): God must have been watching.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): God must have been watching.
PC Japanese (JP): 神様はちゃんと見てる。
Russian (RU): Бог наблюдал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Deus deve ter assistido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 神確實一直在看著我們。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 神确实一直在看着我们。

Umineko Project (UP): You had so much more courage than I did, and God didn't abandon you......
Steam (ST): You had so much more courage than I did, and God didn't abandon you...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): You had so much more courage than I did, and God didn't abandon you......
PC Japanese (JP): 僕よりはるかに勇気を持っていた君を、神様はお見捨てにならなかったんだ……。
Russian (RU): Ты была гораздо храбрее меня, и Бог не бросил тебя......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você teve muito mais coragem do que eu, e Deus não abandonou você......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是因為，神沒有捨棄，遠比我勇敢的你……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是因为，神没有舍弃，远比我勇敢的你……。

Umineko Project (UP): I reached the hallway with the guest rooms.{n}......There was someone lying on the ground.
Steam (ST): I reached the hallway with the guest rooms. ...There was someone lying on the ground.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I reached the hallway with the guest rooms.......There was someone lying on the ground.
PC Japanese (JP): 客室の並ぶ廊下に至る。……そこに人間が倒れているのが見える。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 客室の並ぶ廊下に至る。{n}……そこに人間が倒れているのが見える。
Russian (RU): Я дошёл до коридора с гостевыми комнатами.{n}......Там кто‐то лежал на полу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu cheguei até o corredor do quarto de hóspedes.{n}......Havia alguém caído no chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 來到了一字排開的客房的走廊。{n}……看到那裡倒著一個人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 来到了一字排开的客房的走廊。{n}……看到那里倒着一个人。

Umineko Project (UP): It was Battler. ......He was lying just outside the guest room, a chain tied to his neck.
Steam (ST): It was Battler. ...He was lying just outside the guest room, a chain tied to his neck.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was Battler. ......He was lying just outside the guest room, a chain tied to his neck.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人だ。……首を鎖に繋がれたまま、客室を出たすぐのところで倒れている。
Russian (RU): Баттлер. ......Он лежал снаружи гостевой комнаты с цепью, привязанной к шее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era o Battler. ......Ele estava caído do lado de fora do quarto de hóspedes, com a corrente presa em seu pescoço.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是戰人。……他脖子上鎖著鎖鏈，倒在客房一出門的地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是战人。……他脖子上锁着锁链，倒在客房一出门的地方。

Umineko Project (UP): ......He had probably struggled to do something with the chain lock from the outside until he lost consciousness...
Steam (ST): ...He had probably struggled to do something with the chain lock from the outside until he lost consciousness...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……外からチェーンを何とかしようと、意識を失うまでもがき続けたのだろう…。
Russian (RU): ......Наверное, пытался что‐то сделать с цепным замком извне, пока не потерял сознание...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Provavelmente, ele tentou lutar contra a corrente de porta, pelo lado exterior, até perder a consciência...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……是直到失去意識之前，想盡了各種辦法想從外面掛上門鏈吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……是直到失去意识之前，想尽了各种办法想从外面挂上门链吧…。

Umineko Project (UP): His fingernails on both hands had been torn off, and they were stained with blood.
Steam (ST): His fingernails on both hands had been torn off, and they were stained with blood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): His fingernails on both hands had been torn off, and they were stained with blood.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼の両手の生爪が剥がれ、血塗れになっている。
Russian (RU): Его ногти на обеих руках были сорваны и запачканы кровью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As unhas de ambas as mãos haviam sido arrancadas, e estavam manchadas de sangue.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他雙手的指甲都破損了，沾滿了血。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他双手的指甲都破损了，沾满了血。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I could tell at a glance just how hard he had tried until the final moment when his heart had died.
Steam (ST): ...I could tell at a glance just how hard he had tried until the final moment when his heart had died.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……彼が心を死なせる最後の瞬間まで、どれほどの努力をしたかが、一目でわかった。
Russian (RU): ......С первого взгляда было видно, как он старался до самого последнего момента, пока его сердце не остановилось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Só de vê‐lo nesse estado, eu podia dizer o quanto ele lutou até o último instante, quando seu coração morreu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在死心的最後一刻之前，他究竟做了多大的努力，是一目了然的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在死心的最后一刻之前，他究竟做了多大的努力，是一目了然的。

Umineko Project (UP): The collar binding him wouldn't disappear unless the chain lock was set.
Steam (ST): The collar binding him wouldn't disappear unless the chain lock was set.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The collar binding him wouldn't disappear unless the chain lock was set.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼を縛る首輪は、チェーンロックを掛けなければ、消えない。
Russian (RU): Этот ошейник, сковывающий его, не исчезнет, если цепной замок не заперт.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A coleira que o prendia não iria desaparecer a não ser que a corrente fosse posta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 將他束縛的項圈，如果沒有掛上門鏈，是不會消失的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 将他束缚的项圈，如果没有挂上门链，是不会消失的。

Speaker: Kanon
Umineko Project (UP): "......Battler‐sama... .........It's alright. ...I'm going to save you now......"
Steam (ST): "...Battler-sama, ......it's all right. ...I'm going to save you now..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Battler-sama... .........It's alright. ...I'm going to save you now......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……戦人さま…。………大丈夫です。…今、お助けします……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……戦人さま…。………大丈夫です。…今、お助けします……」
Russian (RU): "......Господин Баттлер............ Всё хорошо. Я сейчас спасу вас......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Battler‐sama... .........Está tudo bem. ...Eu vou salvá‐lo agora......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……戰人少爺…。………沒事了。…我現在就來救你……」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……战人少爷…。………没事了。…我现在就来救你……」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Battler responded faintly.
Steam (ST): Battler responded faintly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人はわずかに応えた。
Russian (RU): Баттлер слабо ответил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Battler respondeu com dificuldade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人略微做出了回應。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人略微做出了回应。

Umineko Project (UP): He'd probably never imagined that help would come to this eternal locked room.
Steam (ST): He probably hadn't even imagined that help would come to this eternal closed room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He probably hadn't even imagined that help would come to this eternal closed room.
PC Japanese (JP): この、永遠の密室に助けが来るなんて、想像もしなかっただろう。
Russian (RU): Он, наверное, и представить не мог, что в этой вечной закрытой комнате к нему придёт помощь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele provavelmente nunca imaginou que ajuda viria a este eterno quarto fechado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他想都沒有想過，竟然會有人到這間永恒的密室裡來救他吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他想都没有想过，竟然会有人到这间永恒的密室里来救他吧。

Umineko Project (UP): ......He was so scared that this might be an auditory hallucination brought about by his fleeting delusions......that he couldn't be easily roused...
Steam (ST): ...He was so scared that this might be an auditory hallucination brought about by a fleeting delusion... that he couldn't bear to open his eyes easily...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......He was so scared that this might be an auditory hallucination brought about by his fleeting delusion...... that he couldn't let himself open his eyes easily...
PC Japanese (JP): ……だからそれが、自分の儚い妄想による幻聴かもしれないと、それが恐ろしくて、……なかなか目を覚ませない…。
Russian (RU): ......Его пугала мысль, что это может быть слуховая галлюцинация, вызванная его мимолётным заблуждением...... и он не мог так просто открыть глаза...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele estava com muito medo que isso não passasse de uma alucinação auditiva ocasionada por sua transiente delusão......o que não permitiu que ele despertasse facilmente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……所以，也許這只是因為自己虛幻的妄想而出現的幻聽，由於害怕此，……他遲遲沒有睜開雙眼…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，也许这只是因为自己虚幻的妄想而出现的幻听，由于害怕此，……他迟迟没有睁开双眼…。

Umineko Project (UP): Kanon grabbed Battler from behind and dragged him into the room...
Steam (ST): Kanon grabbed Battler by the arms and dragged him into the room...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kanon grabbed Battler by the arms and dragged him into the room...
PC Japanese (JP): 嘉音は戦人を後ろから羽交い絞めにするようにして、室内に引き摺り入れる…。
Russian (RU): Канон взял Баттлера за руки и потащил в комнату...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kanon agarrou Battler pelas costas e o levou para dentro do quarto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 嘉音從後面架著戰人的胳膊，把他拖進室內…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 嘉音从后面架着战人的胳膊，把他拖进室内…。

Umineko Project (UP): The inside of the room......was terrible.
Steam (ST): The inside of the room...was terrible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The inside of the room......was terrible.
PC Japanese (JP): 室内は、……ひどいものだった。
Russian (RU): Там...... было ужасно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O interior do quarto......estava horrível.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 室內，……一片狼藉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 室内，……一片狼藉。

Umineko Project (UP): The windows had been brutally shattered, and the wind and rain had made its way into the room.
Steam (ST): The windows had been brutally shattered, and the wind and rain had made its way inside.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The windows had been brutally shattered, and the wind and rain had made its way into the room.
PC Japanese (JP): 窓ガラスは無残に割られ、風雨を室内に許している。
Russian (RU): Окна жестоко разбиты — в комнату протиснулись дождь и ветер.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As janelas foram brutalmente destruídas e o vento e a chuva estavam invadindo o cômodo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 窗玻璃被砸得稀爛，讓風雨得以進入室內。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 窗玻璃被砸得稀烂，让风雨得以进入室内。

Umineko Project (UP): All kinds of tools and furniture lay broken there.
Steam (ST): All kinds of tools and furniture lay broken there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All kinds of tools and furniture lay broken there.
PC Japanese (JP): 室内のあらゆる道具、あらゆる家具が、無残に壊されている。
Russian (RU): Валялись сломанными все виды инструментов и мебель.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos os tipos de ferramentas e móveis estavam caídos e quebrados pelo chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 室內所有的道具，所有的家具，都損壞嚴重。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 室内所有的道具，所有的家具，都损坏严重。

Umineko Project (UP): However, Battler hadn't smashed them out of rage.
Steam (ST): However, Battler hadn't smashed them out of rage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, Battler hadn't smashed them out of rage.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは全て、戦人が感情のままに暴れたからではない。
Russian (RU): Но Баттлер разбил всё это не от гнева.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas Battler não havia esmagado‐os por raiva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是這一切，並不是戰人發泄感情造成的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是这一切，并不是战人发泄感情造成的。

Umineko Project (UP): The curtain had been removed and torn to shreds which had been twisted together.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): The curtain had been removed, torn, and twisted up into a bundle.
PC Japanese (JP): カーテンは外されて、破られて、束ねてよじられていた。
Russian (RU): Занавески были сняты, разорваны и скручены в узел.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As cortinas foram removidas e rasgadas em retalhos que foram torcidos juntos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 窗簾被扯下來，撕破了，擰成一股繫著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 窗帘被扯下来，撕破了，拧成一股系着。

Umineko Project (UP): ......He had turned it into a rope, probably while experimenting to see if he could use it for some trick.
Steam (ST): ...He had probably used trial and error to see if that could be used as a rope for some trick.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......He had probably used trial and error to see if that could be used as a rope for some trick.
PC Japanese (JP): ……それでロープを作り、何かのトリックに使えないか、試行錯誤を繰り返したのだろう。
Russian (RU): ......Вероятно, он методом проб и ошибок смотрел, можно ли их использовать как верёвку для какой‐то хитрости.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ele a transformou em uma corda, provavelmente enquanto fazia experimentos para ver se poderia usá‐la para algum tipo de truque.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大概是用它做了繩索，看看能不能在什麼詭計中派上用場，不斷嘗試又不斷失敗吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大概是用它做了绳索，看看能不能在什么诡计中派上用场，不断尝试又不断失败吧。

Umineko Project (UP): He had tried using everything in the room, exploring all possible options of escape.
Steam (ST): He had tried using everything in the room, exploring all possible options of escape.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He had tried using everything in the room, exploring all possible options of escape.
PC Japanese (JP): 全ての脱出の可能性に賭け、室内のあらゆるものを利用しようとしたのだ。
Russian (RU): Он использовал всё, что было в комнате, исследуя все возможные варианты спасения.

Umineko Project (UP): That room was completely sealed with duct tape, and it has been proven that the seal was in effect until the time of the logic error.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 堂兄妹房间通过胶带实现的完全封印，已经证明了一直到发生逻辑错误之时，都是有效的。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Heheh. If I got stuck thinking only about that question, I'd be no better than your average kid detective.

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:1:The cousins' room is guaranteed to be a perfect locked room until the end}. {p:2:So, if Kanon really had been in that room, it would have been impossible for him to escape! In other words, Kanon was not in the cousins' room at the time it was sealed!! Kanon's name is an alias. His real name is still unknown! If his name happened to be the same as anyone in the next room over, that wouldn't contradict the check on who was in that room. In other words, it's possible for him to be in the next room over, not the cousins' room}!!"
Steam (ST): "{p:1:The cousin room is guaranteed to be a perfect closed room until the end.} {p:2:So, if Kanon really was in this room, it would be impossible for him to escape! In other words, Kanon was not in that room at the time it was sealed!! The name "Kanon" is an alias. His real name is still unknown! If his real name happens to be the same as anyone in the next room over, that wouldn't contradict the check on who was in that room. In other words, it's possible for him to be in the next room over, not the cousin room!!}"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "{p:1:The cousins' room is guaranteed to be a perfect closed room until the end.{p:2: So, if Kanon really was in this room, it would be impossible for him to escape! In other words, Kanon was not in that room at the time it was sealed!! Kanon's name is an alias. His real name is still unknown! If his name happened to be the same as anyone in the next room over, that wouldn't contradict the check on who was in that room. In other words, it's possible for him to be in the next room over, not the cousins' room!!}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:1:いとこ部屋は完全な密室が最後まで保証されています。{p:2:よって、嘉音がこの部屋に本当に居たなら、脱出は不可能です！つまり嘉音は封印時にいとこ部屋にいなかったのです！！嘉音の名は仮のもの。本名は未だ不明です！彼の本名が仮に、隣部屋の誰かと同じだったなら、隣部屋の在室確認に矛盾しない。つまり、いとこ部屋に収容されず、隣部屋に居ることが出来るということ！！}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:1:いとこ部屋は完全な密室が最後まで保証されています。{p:2:よって、嘉音がこの部屋に本当に居たなら、脱出は不可能です！　つまり嘉音は封印時にいとこ部屋にいなかったのです！！　嘉音の名は仮のもの。本名は未だ不明です！　彼の本名が仮に、隣部屋の誰かと同じだったなら、隣部屋の在室確認に矛盾しない。つまり、いとこ部屋に収容されず、隣部屋に居ることが出来るということ！！}」
Russian (RU): "{p:1:Комната кузенов до самого конца была гарантированно совершенной закрытой комнатой.} {p:2:И будь Канон там, он бы не смог выбраться! Иначе говоря, когда комната была запечатана, Канона там не было! Его имя — псевдоним. Настоящее всё ещё неизвестно! Если его зовут так же, как кого‐либо в соседней комнате, это не противоречит проверке того, кто там был. Иными словами, он мог быть в соседней комнате, а не в комнате кузенов}!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{p:1:Foi garantido que o quarto dos primos é um quarto perfeito até o final}. {p:2:Logo, se Kanon realmente estivesse naquele quarto, seria impossível que ele escapasse! Ou seja, Kanon não estava no quarto dos primos no momento em que o mesmo foi selado!! O nome de Kanon é um pseudônimo. Seu verdadeiro nome ainda é desconhecido! Se o nome dele for o mesmo que qualquer um no quarto ao lado, isso não iria contradizer a verificação que ocorreu naquele quarto. Em outras palavras, é possível que ele estivesse no quarto ao lado, e não no quarto dos primos}!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「{p:1:堂兄妹房間是完全的密室，這一點直到最後都是受到保證的。}{p:2:因此，嘉音如果真的在這間房裡，就是不可能逃出來的！也就是說，嘉音在封印的時候根本就不在堂兄妹房間裡！！嘉音是個假名字。本名目前不明！假如他的本名跟鄰房裡的某人是一樣的話，就不會與鄰房裡的所在位置確認相矛盾。也就是說，他可以不進入堂兄妹房間，而在鄰房之內！！}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「{p:1:堂兄妹房间是完全的密室，这一点直到最后都是受到保证的。}{p:2:因此，嘉音如果真的在这间房里，就是不可能逃出来的！也就是说，嘉音在封印的时候根本就不在堂兄妹房间里！！嘉音是个假名字。本名目前不明！假如他的本名跟邻房里的某人是一样的话，就不会与邻房里的所在位置确认相矛盾。也就是说，他可以不进入堂兄妹房间，而在邻房之内！！}」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "{p:1:At the time the next room over was sealed, Hideyoshi, George, Kumasawa, Shannon, and Nanjo were in it. And the number of people in the next room over was five. Steam (ST): "{p:1:At the time the next room over was sealed, Hideyoshi, George, Kumasawa, Shannon, and Nanjo were in it. And, the number of people in the next room over was five. No one existed there except for those to whom those five names refer! All people can only go by their own names!!}"

PC Japanese (JP): 「{p:1:封印時の隣部屋に居たのは、秀吉、譲治、熊沢、紗音、南條である。そして、隣部屋の人数は５人である。この５つの名に該当する者以外は存在しない！全ての名は、本人以外には名乗れない！！}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「{p:1:封印時の隣部屋に居たのは、秀吉、譲治、熊沢、紗音、南條である。そして、隣部屋の人数は５人である。この５つの名に該当する者以外は存在しない！　全ての名は、本人以外には名乗れない！！}」
Russian (RU): "{p:1:Когда соседняя комната была запечатана, там были Хидэёши, Джордж, Кумасава, Шаннон и Нанджо. Число людей в соседней комнате — пять. Нет никого, за исключением тех, к кому относятся эти пять упомянутых имён! Все люди могут использовать только свои имена}!"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……{p:2:“戦人の客室失踪”トリックは、以下の通りです。……戦人は私の室内探索中、クローゼット内に隠れていました。そしてバスルームの騒ぎの間に、チェーンを外し、室外へ脱出しました。この時、廊下には嘉音が待機していました。嘉音は入れ替わりで客室に入り、チェーンを施錠しました。これが戦人失踪のトリックです}」
Russian (RU): "......{p:2:‘Трюк с исчезновением Баттлера из гостевой комнаты’ заключается в следующем. ......Пока я обыскивала комнату, Баттлер прятался в шкафу. Во время беспорядка в ванной он снял цепочку и выбрался из комнаты. В коридоре его ждал Канон. Канон вошёл в гостевую комнату вместо него и повесил цепочку. Вот как Баттлер исчез}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......{p:2:‘O truque de desaparecimento do quarto de hóspedes do Battler se deu da seguinte forma: ......Enquanto eu procurava pelo quarto, Battler estava escondido no closet. Então, durante o tumulto no banheiro, ele desfez e corrente e escapou do quarto. Nesse momento, Kanon estava aguardando no corredor. Kanon entrou no quarto de hóspedes e colocou a corrente. Este é o truque do desaparecimento do Battler}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……{p:2:“戰人從客房內失踪”的詭計，如下所述。……我在房間內搜索的時候，戰人躲在衣櫃裡。然後趁著浴室裡發生騷亂的時候，打開鏈條鎖，從房內逃脫。此時，嘉音正在走廊上等待。嘉音代替戰人進入客房，鎖上鏈條鎖。這就是戰人失踪的詭計。}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……{p:2:“战人从客房内失踪”的诡计，如下所述。……我在房间内搜索的时候，战人躲在衣柜里。然后趁着浴室里发生骚乱的时候，打开链条锁，从房内逃脱。此时，嘉音正在走廊上等待。嘉音代替战人进入客房，锁上链条锁。这就是战人失踪的诡计。}」
